intro: Corydalis solida subsp. slivenensis, commonly known as the Slivenensis Corydalis, is a flowering plant native to the Balkan Peninsula. It belongs to the family Fumariaceae and is characterized by its delicate, spurred flowers that typically bloom in shades of pink and purple. The plant features slender stems and lance-shaped leaves, often growing in rocky or alpine environments. It is a perennial herb that thrives in well-drained soils and cooler climates. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and endangered species in its native range.
